message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.GT, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a problem with the incentive structure of Bitcoin, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the importance of information propagation in decentralized systems, which falls under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). The paper uses game theory to analyze the incentives of Bitcoin participants, which falls under the category of game theory and decision science (cs.GT). The paper proposes a modification to the Bitcoin protocol to incentivize information propagation, which falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of Sybil-proofness in the proposed modification, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
